page.title: 08SOPLEY VILLAGE
page.content: {Sopley}is the largest village in our survey area. The history of the village goes back to Saxon times when a battle was fought on the site where the church is now to be found. The name of Sopley was taken from the saxon leader{Soper}the original name being{Sopersley}. The village has grown in recent years as the nearby towns of { {Christchurch}and{Bournemouth}spread towards the{New Forest.}A new housing estate has doubled the original population but the village still manages to retain much of its charm. There is a general store and post office, a public house and a village hall to serve the local population. The church is described on an earlier page and can be found near the old water mill which is now used as a warehouse.
